page.title: 18Wimbish Primary School
page.content: The main building is over 100 years old but there have been additions and improvements in recent years.In 1985 there are 90 children on roll aged from 5 to 11 years.The children follow a varied curriculum though Reading, English and Mathematics are considered very important.At Christmas all the children take part in a musical play which is so popular with parents and friends it has to be performed at least twice.In the Autumn the School holds a Harvest Festival Service to which all the children bring gifts of flowers,fruit,groceries or vegetables. These gifts are later taken in gaily decorated baskets to about 40 sick or elderly people in the Parish.Sport is popular athletics,football,netball, rounders & swimming-many can swim over 2,000metres and gain the Gold,Silver or Bronze Amateur Swimming Awards.
